thread.title: Win George Harrison’s Career-Spanning The Vinyl Collection Box Set + Expanded Edition Memoir
thread.title_full: Win George Harrison’s Career-Spanning The Vinyl Collection Box Set + Expanded Edition Memoir

author: Stereogum
title: Win George Harrison’s Career-Spanning The Vinyl Collection Box Set + Expanded Edition Memoir
text:
Stereogum | 3:53 pm Share < br />this article: 
George Harrison would have been 64 on February 25th, and to commemorate the late Beatles’ birthday, all of Harrison’s solo studio albums are being released in one collection for the very first time. George Harrison – The Vinyl Collection spans the entirety of the musician’s career, and includes 1968’s Wonderwall Music , 1969’s Electronic Sound , 1970’s All Things Must Pass , 1973’s Living In The Material World , 1974’s Dark Horse , 1975’s Extra Texture , 1976’s Thirty Three & 1/3 , 1979’s self-titled, 1981’s Somewhere In England , 1982’s Gone Troppo , 1987’s Cloud Nine , 1992’s Live In Japan , and 2002’s Brainwashed . The box set also included 12″ picture disc singles of “When We Was Fab” and “Got My Mind Set On You.” 
Harrison’s 1980 memoir I Me Mine is also getting a new extended edition that brings the book up to date with the rest of his career, all told through Harrison’s own words. The book features 141 songs with handwritten lyric sheets, including 50 songs not included in previous editions. 
The box set and book normally retail for $505 altogether, but we’re giving one lucky reader the set and the memoir for free. 
To enter this sweepstakes, you need be a fan of Stereogum on Facebook and comment below on this very post with your favorite George Harrison album using Facebook login. (Do not use your ‘Gum user account on this post — we’ll have to be able to confirm you are a fan of Stereogum on FB when the sweepstakes ends.) Winner will be chosen randomly. Winner must be located in the United States The sweepstakes ends on 3/6 at 6PM EST. Good luck! 
George Harrison – The Vinyl Collection is available through UMe . I Me Mine – The Extended Edition is available through Genesis Publications .
